intro: Berchemiella yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan berchemia, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
